subsection.leadIn: In these Rules, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: AdjustedLiabilities
def.leadIn: adjusted liabilities (經調整負債), for the purpose of calculating the variable required liquid capital in relation to a licensed corporation, means the sum of its on-balance sheet liabilities including provisions made for liabilities already incurred or for contingent liabilities, but excluding—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: amounts payable to clients in respect of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: client money held by it in a segregated account in accordance with the Securities and Futures (Client Money) Rules (Cap. 571 sub. leg. I);

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: client money held by it in a segregated account with an approved bank incorporated outside Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: client money held by it in a segregated account with a futures or options clearing house; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.leadIn: client money held by it with—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a clearing house other than a futures or options clearing house;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a clearing participant;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a futures dealer; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: a securities dealer,

subparagraph.continued: as margin in respect of outstanding futures contracts and outstanding unlisted options contracts held by it on behalf of its clients; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.leadIn: any amount of scheme money held by a licensed corporation licensed for Type 13 regulated activity in—

subparagraph.content: to the extent not covered in subparagraph (i), a segregated account with an authorized financial institution; or

paragraph.name: ac
paragraph.leadIn: any amount held by a licensed corporation licensed for Type 13 regulated activity on behalf of—

subparagraph.content: subscribers or scheme participants of a relevant CIS constituting subscription proceeds in respect of the relevant CIS;
unit holders, shareholders or scheme participants of a relevant CIS constituting distribution proceeds in respect of the relevant CIS,

paragraph.continued: in an account which is separate from its own account and designated for holding such proceeds maintained with an authorized financial institution, a bank incorporated outside Hong Kong or a person approved by the Commission under section 4(2) or 10B(2) of the Securities and Futures (Client Money) Rules (Cap. 571 sub. leg. I) for the purposes of those Rules; (L.N. 56 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an approved subordinated loan provided to it; and (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any amount of its on-balance sheet liabilities which—

subparagraph.content: arises from a tenancy agreement entered into by it in respect of any premises which it uses in carrying on the regulated activity for which it is licensed; and
is equal to the total value of its assets arising from the tenancy agreement which are not included in its liquid assets under any provision in Division 3 of Part 4; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subsection.def: aggregate gross foreign currency position (合計外幣總持倉量) means the aggregate of all the gross foreign currency positions held by a licensed corporation licensed for Type 3 regulated activity, excluding positions held with a recognized counterparty;

def.name: AmountOfMarginRequiredToBeDeposited
def.leadIn: amount of margin required to be deposited (按規定須存放的保證金數額) means the amount of money required to be deposited as margin (whether the requirement is met by depositing the amount of money or by the provision of security instead of making such deposit)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: upon opening a position; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for maintaining an existing position,

def.continued: in a futures contract or an unlisted options contract, calculated as the highest of the prevailing margin amounts set by— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the exchange on which the futures contract or unlisted options contract is traded; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the clearing house who registers such trade;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the agent who executes such trade for the licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the counterparty who executes such trade with the licensed corporation; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the licensed corporation itself;

def.name: ApprovedBankIncorporatedOutsideHongKong
def.leadIn: approved bank incorporated outside Hong Kong (核准的在香港以外成立為法團的銀行) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a bank incorporated under the law or other authority of a prescribed country, and includes any of its branches or wholly owned subsidiaries which is a bank; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: approved credit rating agency (核准信貸評級機構) means a person approved as such under section 58(1)(b);
approved introducing agent (核准介紹代理人) means a licensed corporation approved as such under section 58(4);

def.name: ApprovedSecuritiesBorrowingAndLendingCounterparty
def.leadIn: approved securities borrowing and lending counterparty (核准證券借貸對手方) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized clearing house; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person approved as such under section 58(1)(c);

subsection.def: approved standby subordinated loan facility (核准備用後償貸款融通) means a standby subordinated loan facility obtained by a licensed corporation licensed for Type 1, Type 2, Type 3 or Type 8 regulated activity, which is approved as such under section 58(5)(c);
approved subordinated loan (核准後償貸款) means a subordinated loan obtained by a licensed corporation approved as such under section 58(5)(b);

def.name: AuthorizedFinancialInstitution
def.leadIn: authorized financial institution (認可財務機構) means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any wholly owned subsidiary of a bank referred to in paragraph (a) which is a bank; or

paragraph.name: c

subsection.def: authorized fund (認可基金) means a unit trust or mutual fund that is authorized by the Commission under section 104 of the Ordinance; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

def.name: BasicAmount
def.leadIn: basic amount (基本數額), in relation to a licensed corporation, means 5% of the aggregate of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its adjusted liabilities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other than a licensed corporation licensed for Type 13 regulated activity in relation to the carrying on by it of Type 13 regulated activity, the aggregate of the initial margin requirements in respect of outstanding futures contracts and outstanding unlisted options contracts held by it on behalf of its clients; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: other than a licensed corporation licensed for Type 13 regulated activity in relation to the carrying on by it of Type 13 regulated activity, the aggregate of the amounts of margin required to be deposited in respect of outstanding futures contracts and outstanding unlisted options contracts held by it on behalf of its clients, to the extent that such contracts are not subject to payment of initial margin requirements; (L.N. 196 of 2018; L.N. 56 of 2023)

def.name: ClearingHouse
def.leadIn: clearing house (結算所) means a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose activities or objects include the provision of services for the clearing and settlement of transactions in, or the day-to-day adjustment of the financial position of, futures contracts or unlisted options contracts effected on an exchange; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose activities or objects include the provision of services for the clearing and settlement of transactions in securities effected on an exchange; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: who guarantees the settlement of any such transactions as are referred to in paragraph (a) or (b),

def.continued: but does not include a corporation operated by or on behalf of the Government;

def.name: ClearingParticipant
def.leadIn: clearing participant (結算所參與者)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a recognized clearing house, means a clearing participant within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a clearing house other than a recognized clearing house, means a person who, in accordance with the rules of the clearing house, may participate in one or more of the services provided by the clearing house in its capacity as a clearing house, and whose name is entered in a list, roll or register kept by the clearing house as a person who may participate in one or more of the services provided by the clearing house;

def.name: Collateral
def.leadIn: collateral (抵押品), in relation to a licensed corporation, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any listed shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any specified securities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any qualifying debt securities; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any special debt securities,

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: are deposited as security by the licensed corporation with another person; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: are deposited as security with the licensed corporation by another person, and—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: are unencumbered in its possession and readily realizable by it;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: are encumbered only by virtue of being lent, deposited or pledged by it in accordance with the requirements of the Securities and Futures (Client Securities) Rules (Cap. 571 sub. leg. H); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: to which the Securities and Futures (Client Securities) Rules (Cap. 571 sub. leg. H) do not apply, are encumbered only by virtue of being deposited or pledged by it with or to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an authorized financial institution or an approved bank incorporated outside Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a person who is licensed, registered or authorized by an authority or regulatory organization outside Hong Kong, for an activity which, if carried on in Hong Kong, would constitute Type 1, Type 2, Type 3 or Type 8 regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a clearing house of a specified exchange or any of its clearing participants to secure its obligation to meet its clearing obligations or liabilities;

subsection.def: collateralized warrants (有抵押權證) means derivative warrants listed on a recognized stock market in respect of which the issuer owns all of the underlying securities or other assets to which the warrants relate and grants a charge over those securities or assets in favour of an independent trustee who acts for the benefit of the warrantholders;

common client (共同客戶) means a client of a securities dealer who is also a client of a licensed corporation licensed for Type 8 regulated activity and whose dealings in securities by the securities dealer are settled on his behalf by the licensed corporation;

def.name: ControlledAsset
def.leadIn: controlled asset (受管制資產) means an asset—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that is an amount of a currency which, because a relevant prohibition applies to the currency, cannot (or cannot without approval from an authority or regulatory organization)—

subparagraph.content: be remitted to Hong Kong; or
be exchanged into another currency which can be remitted to Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: coupon payment (票息付款), in relation to any securities or instrument, means a payment of interest (or other periodic return of a similar nature) to the holder of the securities or instrument during the tenor of securities or instrument, that is calculated by reference to the principal value in accordance with the terms and conditions of the securities or instrument; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

derivative contract (衍生工具合約) means an agreement the purpose or effect of which is to obtain a profit or avoid a loss by reference to the value or price of property of any description or an index or other factor designated for that purpose in the agreement, and includes a futures contract or an options contract;
equities (股本) means shares issued by a corporation (including shares in a mutual fund) and units in a unit trust; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

equity-linked instruments (股票掛鉤票據) means securities within the description of such instruments under rules made under section 23 or 36 of the Ordinance governing the listing of securities and which are listed on a recognized stock market; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

def.name: ExchangeParticipant
def.leadIn: exchange participant (交易所參與者)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a recognized exchange company, means an exchange participant within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an exchange outside Hong Kong, means a person who, in accordance with the rules of the exchange, may trade through that exchange, and whose name is entered in a list, roll or register kept by the exchange as a person who may trade through that exchange;

def.name: ExcludedLiabilities
def.leadIn: excluded liabilities (豁除負債), in relation to the on-balance sheet liabilities of a licensed corporation, means— (L.N. 56 of 2023)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: amounts payable to clients in respect of— (L.N. 56 of 2023)

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: client money held by it in a segregated account in accordance with the Securities and Futures (Client Money) Rules (Cap. 571 sub. leg. I);

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: client money held by it in a segregated account with an approved bank incorporated outside Hong Kong and, to the extent not covered in subparagraph (i), in a segregated account with an authorized financial institution;

subparagraph.name: c
subparagraph.content: client money held by it in a segregated account with a recognized clearing house; (L.N. 56 of 2023)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any amount of scheme money held by a licensed corporation licensed for Type 13 regulated activity in—

subparagraph.content: a segregated account in accordance with the Securities and Futures (Client Money) Rules (Cap. 571 sub. leg. I); or

a segregated account with a bank incorporated outside Hong Kong and, to the extent not covered in subparagraph (i), a segregated account with an authorized financial institution; and (L.N. 56 of 2023)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any amount held by a licensed corporation licensed for Type 13 regulated activity on behalf of—

subparagraph.content: subscribers or scheme participants of a relevant CIS constituting subscription proceeds in respect of the relevant CIS;
unit holders, shareholders or scheme participants of a relevant CIS constituting distribution proceeds in respect of the relevant CIS,

paragraph.continued: in an account which is separate from its own account and designated for holding such proceeds maintained with an authorized financial institution, a bank incorporated outside Hong Kong or a person approved by the Commission under section 4(2) or 10B(2) of the Securities and Futures (Client Money) Rules (Cap. 571 sub. leg. I) for the purposes of those Rules; (L.N. 56 of 2023)

def.name: FloatingLosses
def.leadIn: floating losses (浮動虧損) means unrealized losses calculated by marking to market an open position in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a futures contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any securities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an options contract;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a derivative contract;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a leveraged foreign exchange contract;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a foreign exchange agreement;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: a specified investment;
an illiquid investment; or (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a miscellaneous investment; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

def.name: FloatingProfits
def.leadIn: floating profits (浮動利潤) means unrealized profits calculated by marking to market an open position in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a futures contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any securities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an options contract;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a derivative contract;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a leveraged foreign exchange contract;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a foreign exchange agreement;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: a specified investment;
an illiquid investment; or (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a miscellaneous investment; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

def.name: ForeignCurrency
def.leadIn: foreign currency (外幣), in relation to a licensed corporation, means any currency other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its reporting currency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any currency which has an exchange rate which is linked to the reporting currency;

def.name: FreeDeliveryBasis
def.leadIn: free delivery basis (信用交付形式) means the basis on which a sale or purchase of securities is effected, under which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delivery of the securities by the seller takes place irrespective of whether the seller has received payment in settlement of a liability arising from the sale of the securities; or

paragraph.name: b

def.name: FuturesDealer
def.leadIn: futures dealer (期貨交易商) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation licensed for Type 2 regulated activity; or

paragraph.name: b

def.name: FuturesOrOptionsClearingHouse
def.leadIn: futures or options clearing house (期貨或期權結算所) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recognized clearing house other than a recognized clearing house whose activities or objects include the provision of services for the clearing and settlement of transactions in securities (other than unlisted options contracts); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: whose activities or objects include the provision of services for—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the clearing and settlement of transactions in futures contracts or unlisted options contracts; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the day-to-day adjustment of the financial position of futures contracts or unlisted options contracts,

subparagraph.continued: effected on a specified exchange, or subject to the rules of a specified exchange; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: who guarantees the settlement of any such transactions as are referred to in subparagraph (i),

subsection.def: general clearing participant of HKSCC (香港結算公司全面結算所參與者) means a clearing participant of HKSCC that is authorized in accordance with the rules of HKSCC to provide general clearing services to exchange participants of the Stock Exchange Company; (L.N. 196 of 2018)
gross foreign currency position (外幣總持倉量)—see section 2A; (L.N. 196 of 2018)
haircut amount (扣減數額)—see section 2B; (L.N. 196 of 2018)
haircut percentage (扣減百分率)—see section 2C; (L.N. 196 of 2018)
HKSCC (香港結算公司) means the recognized clearing house known as Hong Kong Securities Clearing Company Limited; (L.N. 196 of 2018)
Hong Kong Exchange Fund (香港外匯基金) means the Exchange Fund established under the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66);

def.name: IlliquidInvestment
def.leadIn: illiquid investment (低流通性投資項目) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shares that are not listed, except shares in a mutual fund that do not fall within paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: units in a unit trust or shares in a mutual fund, where the unit trust or mutual fund—

subparagraph.content: is not an authorized fund, a recognized jurisdiction fund or a specified exchange traded fund; or

subparagraph.leadIn: is an authorized fund or a recognized jurisdiction fund, but—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is not a specified exchange traded fund; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the units or shares are not redeemable within 30 days;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: debt securities that are not marketable debt securities;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: listed securities that have been suspended from trading for at least 3 trading days or ceased trading on any exchange on which the securities were listed, except where the securities can continue to be traded on any other exchange on which the securities are listed; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a commodity that is not a tradable commodity; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

def.name: InitialMarginRequirement
def.leadIn: initial margin requirement (規定開倉保證金) means the amount of money required to be deposited (whether the requirement is met by depositing the amount of money or by the provision of security instead of making such deposit) upon opening a position in a futures contract or an unlisted options contract, calculated as the highest of the prevailing margin amounts set by— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exchange on which the futures contract or unlisted options contract is traded; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the clearing house who registers such trade;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the agent who executes such trade for the licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the counterparty who executes such trade with the licensed corporation; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the licensed corporation itself;

subsection.def: interest rate swap agreement (掉期息率協議) means an agreement whereby the parties to the agreement agree to exchange a series of interest payments over time;

def.name: InthemoneyAmount
def.leadIn: in-the-money amount (價內值) means the amount calculated according to the following applicable formula—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a call options contract, N x (M – S);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a put options contract, N x (S – M); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a call warrant on listed shares, N x (M – S),
paragraph.continued:
where—
“N” represents—

subparagraph.content: if the asset underlying the options contract or warrant is shares—the number of such shares;
if the asset underlying the options contract is an asset other than shares—the number of units of such asset; or
if an index underlies the options contract—the contract multiplier;

paragraph.continued: “M” represents—

subparagraph.content: if the asset underlying the options contract or warrant is shares—the market value of one such share;
if the asset underlying the options contract is an asset other than shares—the market value of one unit of such asset; or
if an index underlies the options contract—the current level of the index; and

paragraph.continued: “S” represents the strike price of the options contract or the exercise price of the warrant—

subparagraph.content: if the asset underlying the options contract is an asset other than shares—for one unit of such asset; or

subsection.def: liquid capital (速動資金), in relation to a licensed corporation, means the amount by which its liquid assets exceeds its ranking liabilities;
listed (上市)—see section 2D; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

def.name: MarginClient
def.leadIn: margin client (保證金客戶)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a licensed corporation licensed for Type 1 regulated activity, means a client to whom the licensed corporation provides securities margin financing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a licensed corporation licensed for Type 8 regulated activity, means any of its clients;

def.name: MarketableDebtSecurities
def.leadIn: marketable debt securities (有價債務證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: certificates of deposit issued by an authorized financial institution or an approved bank incorporated outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: debt securities (other than certificates of deposit referred to in paragraph (a)) in respect of which—

subparagraph.content: there are genuine offers to buy and sell so that a price reasonably related to the last sales price or current bid and offer quotations can be determined within 1 business day, and transactions can be settled at that determined price promptly in accordance with trading conventions; or

subparagraph.leadIn: quotations are available within 1 business day from any combination of 2 or more of the following persons who customarily deal in the debt securities—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: market makers;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: banks;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: securities dealers outside Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: licensed corporations; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

def.name: MarkingToMarket
def.leadIn: marking to market (按照市值計算差額) means the method or procedure of adjusting the valuation of an open position in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a futures contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any securities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an options contract;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a derivative contract;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a leveraged foreign exchange contract;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a foreign exchange agreement;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: a specified investment; (L.N. 196 of 2018)
an illiquid investment; or (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a miscellaneous investment, (L.N. 196 of 2018)

def.continued: to reflect its current market value;

subsection.def: mutual fund (互惠基金) means any arrangement made for the purpose, or having the effect, of providing facilities for investment in shares in a corporation which is or holds itself out as being engaged primarily in the business of investing, reinvesting or trading in securities or any other property whatsoever and which is offering for sale or has outstanding any redeemable shares of which it is the issuer;

no sponsor work licensing condition (不任保薦人發牌條件), in relation to a licensed corporation licensed for Type 6 regulated activity, means a licensing condition that the licensed corporation must not act as a sponsor in respect of an application for the listing on a recognized stock market of any securities; (L.N. 117 of 2006; L.N. 196 of 2018)
non-collateralized warrants (非抵押權證) means derivative warrants listed on a recognized stock market other than collateralized warrants;

note issuance and revolving underwriting facility (票據的發行及循環式包銷融通) means an arrangement under which a borrower may draw down funds up to an agreed limit over an agreed period of time (the term to maturity of the facility) by making repeated note issues to the market, and where, should an issue prove unable to be placed in the market, the unplaced amount is to be taken up or funds made available by the underwriter of the facility;
off-exchange traded derivative contracts (場外買賣衍生工具合約) means derivative contracts which are traded other than on an exchange;

omnibus account (客戶匯集綜合帳戶) means an account opened with a licensed corporation by a client of the licensed corporation, and the client has notified it that the account is to be operated by him as agent for the benefit of 2 or more other persons;

def.name: OptionsContract
def.leadIn: options contract (期權合約) means a contract which gives the holder of the contract the option or right, exercisable at or before a time specified in the contract to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: buy or sell—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at an agreed consideration an agreed quantity of a specified futures contract, share or other property; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an agreed value of a specified futures contract, share or other property; or

paragraph.name: b

def.name: OutofthemoneyAmount
def.leadIn: out-of-the-money amount (價外值) means the amount calculated according to the following applicable formula—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a call options contract, N x (S – M);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a put options contract, N x (M – S); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a call warrant on listed shares, N x (S – M),
paragraph.continued:
where—
“N” represents—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: where the asset underlying the options contract is an asset other than shares, the number of units of such asset;

paragraph.continued: “M” represents the market value of—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: where the asset underlying the options contract is an asset other than shares, one unit of such asset; and

paragraph.continued: “S” represents the strike price of the options contract or the exercise price of the warrant—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the asset underlying the options contract or warrant is shares, for one such share; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the asset underlying the options contract is an asset other than shares, for one unit of such asset;

def.name: PrescribedCountry
def.leadIn: prescribed country (訂明國家) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a country belonging to the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Singapore;

subsection.def: principal value (本金額), in relation to any securities or instrument, means the nominal, face, par or similar value of the securities or instrument; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

def.name: QualifyingDebtSecurities
def.leadIn: qualifying debt securities (合資格債務證券) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: debenture stock, loan stock, debentures, bonds, notes and any securities or other instruments acknowledging, evidencing or creating indebtedness—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: which are issued or guaranteed by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the Central People’s Government of the People’s Republic of China or the People’s Bank of China;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the Government; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the Hong Kong Exchange Fund;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which are issued by the Hong Kong Mortgage Corporation;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: the issuer of which has at least one issue currently rated by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: Moody’s Investors Service at either Baa or Prime-3 or above;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: Standard & Poor’s Corporation at either BBB or A-3 or above; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: BA
subparagraph.content: Fitch Ratings at either BBB or F3 or above; or (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: an approved credit rating agency at or above a grade specified by the Commission under section 58(2)(b); or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.leadIn: the guarantor of which has at least one issue currently rated by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: Moody’s Investors Service at either A or Prime-2 or above;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: Standard & Poor’s Corporation at either A or A-2 or above; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: BA
subparagraph.content: Fitch Ratings at either A or F2 or above; or (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: C

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Meaning of gross foreign currency position

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules—

def.name: GrossForeignCurrencyPosition
def.leadIn: gross foreign currency position (外幣總持倉量), in relation to a licensed corporation’s position in a foreign currency, means the total of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the aggregate of—

subparagraph.content: the value of assets, other than fixed assets, beneficially owned by the licensed corporation which are denominated in the foreign currency; and
all of the licensed corporation’s on-balance sheet liabilities, other than excluded liabilities, which are denominated in the foreign currency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (2), the aggregate of—

subparagraph.content: the total amount of the foreign currency in respect of which the licensed corporation is exposed to the risk of a decline in the value of the foreign currency under outstanding contracts (including spot contracts); and

the total amount of the foreign currency in respect of which the licensed corporation is exposed to the risk of a rise in the value of the foreign currency under outstanding contracts (including spot contracts).

subsection.content: In respect of a pair of outstanding contracts referred to in subsection (3), the licensed corporation must include in the amounts referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition of gross foreign currency position in subsection (1) the amounts specified in subsection (4).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies in respect of a pair of outstanding contracts which the licensed corporation holds with a client (except a client whose account with the licensed corporation is an omnibus account) if the licensed corporation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under one of the contracts (contract 1), is exposed to the risk of a decline in the value of an amount of a currency (currency A) and to the risk of a rise in the value of an amount (amount X) of another currency (currency B); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under the other contract (contract 2), is exposed to the risk of a decline in the value of amount X of currency B and to the risk of a rise in the value of an amount of currency A.

subsection.leadIn: The amounts specified are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to currency A—the higher of the amounts in respect of which the licensed corporation is exposed to the risk of a decline in the value of currency A under contract 1 and to the risk of a rise in the value of currency A under contract 2; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to currency B—the amount X.

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules—

def.name: HaircutAmount
def.leadIn: haircut amount (扣減數額), subject to subsection (2), means, in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any listed shares (except shares that are specified securities or an illiquid investment)—an amount derived by multiplying the market value of the shares by the haircut percentage in relation to the shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any qualifying debt securities—an amount derived by multiplying the market value of the qualifying debt securities by the haircut percentage in relation to the qualifying debt securities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any special debt securities—an amount derived by multiplying the market value of the special debt securities by the haircut percentage in relation to the special debt securities;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any specified securities—an amount derived by multiplying the market value of the specified securities by the haircut percentage in relation to the specified securities;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a specified investment—an amount derived by multiplying the market value of the specified investment by the haircut percentage in relation to the specified investment;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an illiquid investment—an amount derived by multiplying the market value of the illiquid investment by the haircut percentage in relation to the illiquid investment; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a miscellaneous investment—an amount derived by multiplying the market value of the miscellaneous investment by the haircut percentage in relation to the miscellaneous investment.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to any securities or investment referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (g) of the definition of haircut amount in subsection (1) that aims to deliver a daily return on the securities or investment that is equivalent to a certain multiple (leverage factor) of the daily return on a particular index or particular reference asset, haircut amount (扣減數額) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the maximum loss that may be incurred in relation to the securities or investment is the market value of the securities or investment and the relevant holding is not a short position—the lower of—

subparagraph.content: the market value; and

an amount derived by multiplying the amount referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (g) of the definition of haircut amount in subsection (1) (as applicable) by the leverage factor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—an amount derived by multiplying the amount referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (g) of the definition of haircut amount in subsection (1) (as applicable) by the leverage factor.

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules—

def.name: HaircutPercentage
def.leadIn: haircut percentage (扣減百分率) means, in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any listed shares (except shares that are specified securities or an illiquid investment)—the percentage specified in subsection (2) or (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any qualifying debt securities—the percentage specified in subsection (4);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any special debt securities—the percentage specified in subsection (5);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any specified securities—the percentage specified in subsection (6);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a specified investment—the percentage specified in subsection (7); or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an illiquid investment or a miscellaneous investment—the percentage specified in subsection (8).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), in relation to any listed shares (except shares that are specified securities or an illiquid investment), the percentage specified for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of haircut percentage in subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1 in Schedule 2 (Table 1) opposite the applicable description set out in column 2 of Table 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the shares fall within more than one of the descriptions set out in column 2 of Table 1—the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1 opposite any of the applicable descriptions set out in column 2 of Table 1, as elected by a licensed corporation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the shares fall within a description set out in—

subparagraph.content: item 1(a) or (b) in column 2 of Table 1—the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1 opposite the description set out in item 1(c) in column 2 of Table 1, if elected by a licensed corporation;
item 2(a)(i) in column 2 of Table 1—the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1 opposite the description set out in item 2(a)(ii) in column 2 of Table 1, if elected by a licensed corporation;
item 3(a)(i) in column 2 of Table 1—the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1 opposite the description set out in item 3(a)(ii) in column 2 of Table 1, if elected by a licensed corporation;
item 4(a)(i) in column 2 of Table 1—the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1 opposite the description set out in item 4(a)(ii) in column 2 of Table 1, if elected by a licensed corporation; or
item 5(a) in column 2 of Table 1—the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1 opposite the description set out in item 5(b) in column 2 of Table 1, if elected by a licensed corporation.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of calculating the haircut amount under section 22(1)(b)(i), in relation to any listed shares (except shares that are specified securities or an illiquid investment) that are listed on a recognized stock market and specified in column 2 of Table 1A in Schedule 2 (Table 1A), the percentage specified for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of haircut percentage in subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c) (and regardless of whether the shares also fall within any of the descriptions set out in column 2 of Table 1), the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1A opposite the applicable description set out in column 2 of Table 1A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if, in a particular month, the shares described in item 1(a), (b), (c) or (d) in column 2 of Table 1A cease to be a constituent of the applicable index and the cessation would result in the assignment to the shares of a percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1A that is higher than the percentage which applied to the shares immediately prior to the cessation (original percentage)—the original percentage, but only in relation to the particular month and for the period of the next 3 consecutive months; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the shares fall within a description set out in item 1(a), (b), (c) or (d) in column 2 of Table 1A—the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1A opposite the applicable description set out in item 1(e) in column 2 of Table 1A, if elected by a licensed corporation.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to any qualifying debt securities, the percentage specified for the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of haircut percentage in subsection (1) is the aggregate of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 4 in Schedule 2 opposite the applicable description set out in column 2 of that Table; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the percentage specified in column 2 or 3 (as the case may be) of Table 5 in Schedule 2 opposite the applicable description set out in column 1 of that Table.

subsection.content: In relation to any special debt securities, the percentage specified for the purposes of paragraph (c) of the definition of haircut percentage in subsection (1) is the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 6 in Schedule 2 opposite the applicable description set out in column 2 of that Table.

In relation to any specified securities, the percentage specified for the purposes of paragraph (d) of the definition of haircut percentage in subsection (1) is the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 7 in Schedule 2 opposite the applicable description set out in column 2 of that Table.

In relation to a specified investment, the percentage specified for the purposes of paragraph (e) of the definition of haircut percentage in subsection (1) is the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 8 in Schedule 2 opposite the applicable description set out in column 2 of that Table.

In relation to an illiquid investment or a miscellaneous investment, the percentage specified for the purposes of paragraph (f) of the definition of haircut percentage in subsection (1) is the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 9 in Schedule 2 opposite the applicable description set out in column 2 of that Table.

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules—

def.name: Listed
def.leadIn: listed (上市), in relation to securities which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of the definition of listed in section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Ordinance are regarded as listed on a recognized stock market—has the meaning given by that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: are regarded as listed on an exchange located in a jurisdiction outside Hong Kong under the laws or regulations of the jurisdiction—means listed on that exchange; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: are admitted to trading on an exchange—means listed on that exchange if—

subparagraph.content: under the laws or regulations of the jurisdiction in which the exchange is located, the securities are regarded as listed on a different exchange located in the same jurisdiction; or
under the laws or regulations of a jurisdiction other than the jurisdiction in which the exchange is located, the securities are regarded as listed on an exchange located in that other jurisdiction.

subsection.content: For the purposes of the definition of listed in subsection (1), securities are to continue to be regarded as listed on, or admitted to trading on, a particular exchange during a period of suspension of dealings in the securities on that exchange.

subsection.leadIn: Despite the definition of listed in subsection (1), securities are not to be regarded as listed on, or admitted to trading on, a particular exchange merely because the exchange provides (directly or indirectly) facilities for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: effecting transactions in the securities on a different exchange; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: transmitting or otherwise communicating by any means offers to effect transactions in the securities on a different exchange.

subsection.content: Despite the definition of listed in subsection (1), securities that are options contracts with standardized contractual terms and conditions specified by a particular exchange are not to be regarded as listed on the particular exchange or on any other exchange on which they are admitted to trading.

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules—

def.name: MiscellaneousInvestment
def.leadIn: miscellaneous investment (雜項投資項目), subject to subsection (2), means any asset or instrument held by a person for the purpose, or with the intention, of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: resale;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: securing a profit from fluctuations in the value of the asset or instrument;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: locking in arbitrage profits; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: hedging any risks of any other asset or instrument held by the person which falls within paragraph (a), (b) or (c).

subsection.leadIn: A miscellaneous investment does not include the following assets or instruments held by a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any securities that fall within any of the descriptions set out in—

subparagraph.content: column 2 of Table 1, 1A, 4, 6 or 7 in Schedule 2;
column 2 or 3 of Table 5 in Schedule 2; or
item 2 in column 2 of Table 8 in Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any securities that are unlisted options contracts;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a derivative contract that is not securities;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a specified investment;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an illiquid investment;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a foreign exchange agreement;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a leveraged foreign exchange contract;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a fixed asset;
cash;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a bank deposit;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: any loan, advance, credit facility or other financial accommodation provided by the person to another person;
any amount receivable by the person.

subsection.leadIn: In these Rules—

def.name: StructuredNote
def.leadIn: structured note (結構性票據) means an instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is in the form of a bond, debenture or note;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that acknowledges, evidences or creates indebtedness, regardless of whether—

subparagraph.content: the holder of the instrument has the right to receive the principal value on or before maturity; or
the issuer of the instrument has the right to terminate the instrument before maturity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that is a structured product within the meaning of section 1A of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Ordinance, except a structured product that—

subparagraph.content: falls within subsection (1)(a)(ii) or (iii) or (b) of that section; or
is an OTC derivative product; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: under the terms and conditions of which the holder is to receive a bearish return or a bullish return (whether or not subject to any deduction or payment of any expense or charge under those terms and conditions) that is determined by comparing the strike price and the settlement price of—

subparagraph.content: a permitted underlying asset; or
a permitted underlying type of rate or index.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of structured note in subsection (1)—

def.name: BearishReturn
def.leadIn: bearish return (看跌式回報), in relation to an instrument, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: both of the following—

subparagraph.content: on or before maturity or termination, one or more coupon payments;
on or after maturity or termination, an amount referred to in paragraph (b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following, on or after maturity or termination—

subparagraph.content: if the settlement price is below the strike price—settlement amount 1;
if the settlement price exceeds the strike price—settlement amount 4;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the settlement price is equal to the strike price—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: settlement amount 1; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: settlement amount 4;

def.name: BullishReturn
def.leadIn: bullish return (看漲式回報), in relation to an instrument, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: both of the following—

subparagraph.content: on or before maturity or termination, one or more coupon payments;
on or after maturity or termination, an amount or quantity referred to in paragraph (b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following, on or after maturity or termination—

subparagraph.content: if the settlement price exceeds the strike price—settlement amount 1;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the settlement price is below the strike price and the instrument has a permitted underlying asset—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the settlement quantity;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: settlement amount 2; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: an amount and a number of units of the permitted underlying asset which together are equivalent in value to settlement amount 2;
if the settlement price is below the strike price and the instrument has a permitted underlying type of rate or index—settlement amount 3;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the settlement price is equal to the strike price and the instrument has a permitted underlying asset—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the settlement quantity;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: settlement amount 1;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: settlement amount 2; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: an amount and a number of units of the permitted underlying asset which together are equivalent in value to settlement amount 2;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the settlement price is equal to the strike price and the instrument has a permitted underlying type of rate or index—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: settlement amount 1; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: settlement amount 3;

subsection.def: maturity (到期), in relation to an instrument, means the date on which the instrument is due to mature;

def.name: PermittedInterestRate
def.leadIn: permitted interest rate (許可利率) means a money market or interbank reference interest rate that is widely quoted in a market that is domiciled in a jurisdiction which is rated by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Moody’s Investors Service at either Baa or Prime-3 or above;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Standard & Poor’s Corporation at either BBB or A-3 or above; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Fitch Ratings at either BBB or F3 or above;

def.name: PermittedSecurities
def.leadIn: permitted securities (許可證券) means securities other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: special debt securities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an illiquid investment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a miscellaneous investment;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a derivative contract; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a structured product;

def.name: PermittedUnderlyingAsset
def.leadIn: permitted underlying asset (許可相關資產), in relation to an instrument, means a single asset that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: permitted securities; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a tradable commodity;

def.name: PermittedUnderlyingTypeOfRateOrIndex
def.leadIn: permitted underlying type of rate or index (屬許可類別的相關比率或指數), in relation to an instrument, means a single type of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: permitted interest rate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: currency exchange rate;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: tradable securities index;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: tradable commodity index; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: tradable currency exchange rate index;

subsection.def: settlement amount 1 (交收數額1), in relation to an instrument, means the sum of the principal value and the outstanding coupon payments;

def.name: SettlementAmount2
def.leadIn: settlement amount 2 (交收數額2), in relation to an instrument that has a permitted underlying asset, means the value of the settlement quantity calculated in accordance with the following formula—

def.name: SettlementAmount3
def.leadIn: settlement amount 3 (交收數額3), in relation to an instrument that has a permitted underlying type of rate or index, means an amount calculated in accordance with the following formula—

def.name: SettlementAmount4
def.leadIn: settlement amount 4 (交收數額4), in relation to an instrument, means the higher of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an amount calculated in accordance with the following formula—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: zero;

def.name: SettlementPrice
def.leadIn: settlement price (交收價) means a price or value of 1 unit of a permitted underlying asset or a level of a permitted underlying type of rate or index that, for the purposes of determining the bearish return or the bullish return under the terms and conditions of an instrument, is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: quoted in a market specified in those terms and conditions at a time specified in, or to be determined in accordance with a method specified in, those terms and conditions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determined in accordance with a method specified in those terms and conditions;

def.name: SettlementQuantity
def.leadIn: settlement quantity (交收數量), in relation to an instrument that has a permitted underlying asset, means the number of units of the asset calculated in accordance with the following formula—

subsection.def: strike price (行使價) means a price or value of 1 unit of a permitted underlying asset or a level of a permitted underlying type of rate or index that is specified in the terms and conditions of an instrument for the purposes of determining the bearish return or the bullish return under those terms and conditions;

termination (終止), in relation to an instrument, means a date before maturity on which the instrument terminates in accordance with the terms and conditions of the instrument or by agreement between the parties to the instrument;
tradable commodity index (流通商品指數) means a tradable index that is calculated by reference to changes in the price or value of a basket of tradable commodities;
tradable currency exchange rate index (流通貨幣匯率指數) means a tradable index that is calculated by reference to changes in the level of a combination of more than one type of currency exchange rate;
tradable index (流通指數) means an index that is traded under a tradable contract;
tradable securities index (流通證券指數) means a tradable index that is calculated by reference to changes in the price or value of a basket of permitted securities.

section.name: s2G
section.heading: References to exchange and clearing house
section.leadIn: In these Rules, a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an exchange includes a reference to any market operated by that exchange; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an exchange or clearing house that is specified by name and, after the day on which it is specified—

subparagraph.content: changes its name, is to be read as if it is a reference to the name by which the exchange or clearing house is presently known; or
is succeeded by another exchange or clearing house (whether by reason of merger, amalgamation or otherwise), is to be read as if it is a reference to the successor exchange or clearing house.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of these Rules and subject to subsection (3), a licensed corporation must account for all assets and liabilities— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, unless otherwise specified in these Rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a way that recognizes the substance of a transaction, arrangement or position.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), a licensed corporation must not without notifying the Commission under section 55(5), change any of its accounting principles, other than those referred to in subsection (1)(a), in a way that may materially affect the liquid capital or paid-up share capital that it maintains or is required to maintain under Part 3.
A licensed corporation may, with the Commission’s prior written approval under section 58(5)(d), adopt an accounting principle other than one of those referred to in subsection (1)(a).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Licensed corporations to maintain financial resources
section.content: A licensed corporation must at all times maintain financial resources in the amount required of it under this Part.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Paid-up share capital requirement for licensed corporations
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 4, a licensed corporation other than one which carries on a regulated activity solely as one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved introducing agent who is not a licensed corporation licensed for Type 3 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a trader;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a futures non-clearing dealer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation licensed for Type 4, Type 5, Type 9 or Type 10 regulated activity, which is subject to the specified licensing condition; (L.N. 117 of 2006; L.N. 29 of 2011)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation licensed for Type 6 regulated activity, which is subject to both the specified licensing condition and the no sponsor work licensing condition, (L.N. 117 of 2006)

section.continued: must at all times maintain paid-up share capital of not less than— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: where it is licensed for only one regulated activity specified in column 1 of Table 1 in Schedule 1, the amount specified in column 2 of the Table opposite the regulated activity or, where any further description is set out for the regulated activity in column 1 of the Table, opposite the applicable description; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: where it is licensed for 2 or more regulated activities specified in column 1 of the Table, the amount which is the higher or highest upon comparing each amount specified in column 2 of the Table opposite any of such regulated activities or, where any further description is set out for any of such activities in column 1 of the Table, opposite any of such activities or any of the applicable descriptions.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Liquid capital requirement for licensed corporations

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 4, a licensed corporation must at all times maintain liquid capital which is not less than its required liquid capital. (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (3) and (4) apply in respect of a licensed corporation licensed for one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Type 1 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Type 2 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Type 3 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Type 8 regulated activity,

subsection.continued: unless it is—

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in the case of paragraph (a), an approved introducing agent or a trader;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in the case of paragraph (b), an approved introducing agent, a trader or a futures non-clearing dealer; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in the case of paragraph (c), an approved introducing agent.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on any particular business day on which a licensed corporation’s required liquid capital rises above its liquid capital; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where applicable, on any one or more consecutive business days immediately following the day referred to in paragraph (a) on which there continues to be a required liquid capital deficit,

subsection.continued: the licensed corporation will be regarded as having complied with subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is entitled to draw down an amount not less than the required liquid capital deficit under an approved standby subordinated loan facility; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: its required liquid capital on the day that its required liquid capital rises above its liquid capital is at least 20% more than its required liquid capital at the close of business on the previous business day, as a result of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an increase in its adjusted liabilities which is attributable to an increase in its dealings in securities for its clients;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an increase in the aggregate of the initial margin requirements, or of the amounts of margin required to be deposited, in respect of outstanding futures contracts or outstanding unlisted options contracts held by it on behalf of its clients; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an increase in its aggregate gross foreign currency position;

subparagraph.name: iv
v
subparagraph.content: where applicable, the aggregate of the increases described in 2 or more of subparagraph (i), (ii), (iii) or (iv).

subsection.content: Subsection (3) only applies on a day referred to in subsection (3)(a) or (b) if, during the 60 days immediately preceding that day, the required liquid capital of the licensed corporation has exceeded its liquid capital on 4 or less business days.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Calculation of liquid capital and required liquid capital
section.content: A licensed corporation, for the purposes of calculating its liquid capital and required liquid capital, must account for all its assets, liabilities and transactions in accordance with this Part.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Accounting for transactions on trade date basis
section.leadIn: A licensed corporation, for the purposes of calculating its liquid capital and required liquid capital, must account on a trade date basis for all transactions effected by it, whether as principal or agent, in relation to any dealing or trading in, or entering into— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a futures contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any securities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an options contract;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a derivative contract;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a specified investment;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a leveraged foreign exchange contract;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a foreign exchange agreement;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an interest rate swap agreement;
an illiquid investment; or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a miscellaneous investment.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to the following instruments or assets—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a futures contract;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any securities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an options contract;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a derivative contract;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a specified investment;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a leveraged foreign exchange contract;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a foreign exchange agreement;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an interest rate swap agreement;
an asset underlying a non-collateralized warrant that is issued by a licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: an asset, other than shares, underlying an options contract;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: an illiquid investment;
a miscellaneous investment.

subsection.content: Any reference in these Rules to the market value of an instrument or asset referred to in subsection (1) is, if there is no published market price in respect of the instrument or asset, to be construed as referring to the fair value (as determined in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles) of the instrument or asset.

A licensed corporation must, for the purposes of calculating its liquid capital and required liquid capital, value at market value any open position in an instrument or asset referred to in subsection (1).

Despite subsection (2) or (3), for the purposes of calculating the liquid capital and required liquid capital of a licensed corporation, any reference in these Rules to the market value of the securities referred to in subsection (5), (6) or (7) is to be construed as referring to the value (including any nil value) at which the securities are required to be valued under subsection (5), (6) or (7).

subsection.leadIn: Listed securities that have been suspended from trading for at least 3 trading days or ceased trading on any exchange on which the securities were listed must, unless the securities can continue to be traded on any other exchange on which the securities are listed, be valued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for long positions—at nil; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for short positions—at the higher of fair value and the last closing price before the suspension or cessation of trading.

subsection.leadIn: Marketable debt securities, in respect of which there is no published market price, must be valued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for certificates of deposit—at the value quoted by the issuer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for debt securities other than certificates of deposit—

subparagraph.leadIn: at the average value of quotations obtained from any combination of 2 or more of the following persons who customarily deal in the debt securities—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: market makers;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: banks;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: securities dealers outside Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: licensed corporations; or
if the quotations referred to in subparagraph (i) cannot be obtained—at fair value.

subsection.leadIn: Debt securities that are not marketable debt securities must be valued—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for long positions—at nil; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for short positions—at the higher of fair value and the face value of the debt securities.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Pairs of transactions
section.content: A licensed corporation which enters into a pair of transactions in which its respective roles are opposite, but which otherwise have identical or similar terms, must account for the transactions as separate transactions.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2), (3), (4), (5), (6) and (7) and section 48(2), the assets and liabilities of a licensed corporation must be treated separately on a gross basis and must not be set-off against each other. (L.N. 196 of 2018)

Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of any amounts receivable by a licensed corporation from, and any amounts payable by it to, a recognized clearing house, where the rules of the clearing house permit the setting-off of such amounts against each other for settlement purposes.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of any amounts receivable by a licensed corporation from a person, and any amounts payable by it to the person, where— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: such amounts—

subparagraph.content: do not arise from the carrying on of any regulated activity for which it is licensed; and

subparagraph.leadIn: do not include—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: amounts receivable by it from, and amounts payable by it to, a general clearing participant of HKSCC which arise from transactions in securities that are cleared for it or its clients by the participant with HKSCC;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the licensed corporation is a general clearing participant of HKSCC—amounts receivable by it from the person, and amounts payable by it to the person, which arise from transactions in securities that are cleared for the person by it with HKSCC; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: amounts receivable referred to in section 23(1)(f); and (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has a legally enforceable right to set-off such amounts against each other.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of any amounts receivable by a licensed corporation from, and any amounts payable by it to, a client of the licensed corporation, where such amounts arise from—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchase and sale by the client of securities of the same description due to be settled on a cash-against-delivery basis and the client has authorized the licensed corporation to set-off such amounts;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the purchase and sale by the client of securities in relation to which the licensed corporation has elected to set-off such amounts against each other under section 21(2); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the provision by it to the client of securities margin financing.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of any amounts receivable by a licensed corporation licensed for Type 8 regulated activity from, and any amounts payable by it to, each securities dealer with which it has common clients, where such amounts arise from dealings in securities by the securities dealer for those clients.

Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of any amounts receivable by a licensed corporation licensed for Type 1 regulated activity from, and any amounts payable by it to, each licensed corporation licensed for Type 8 regulated activity with which it has common clients, where such amounts arise from dealings in securities by it for those clients.

If a licensed corporation has obtained an approval under section 58(5)(i), subsection (1) does not apply in respect of amounts receivable (except amounts receivable referred to in section 23(1)(f)) by it from, and amounts payable by it to, a general clearing participant of HKSCC which arise from transactions in securities that are cleared for it or its clients by the participant with HKSCC. (L.N. 196 of 2018)

A licensed corporation must not set-off amounts receivable by it from, and amounts payable by it to, a client of the licensed corporation arising from transactions in different margined accounts maintained with it by the client. (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensed corporation has a client who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: maintains with it more than one margined account;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: has deposited with it security against his liabilities to it in the form of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: cash;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: collateral; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a bank guarantee issued by an authorized financial institution or an approved bank incorporated outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has authorized it to apply such security to satisfy any liabilities to it arising from the execution by it of any transaction in relation to any of his margined accounts,

subsection.continued: the licensed corporation may, subject to subsections (3) and (4)—

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for the purpose of calculating—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a specified shortfall amount in relation to a margined account of the client; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a margin shortfall amount under section 22(1)(b) in relation to the client,

paragraph.continued: deem all or part of such security to be deposited by the client as security to the margined account in relation to which such shortfall amount is calculated; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: for the purpose of calculating any amount to be included in its ranking liabilities under section 45(1) or 46(1) in relation to a margined account of the client, reduce any such amount by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the client has deposited cash referred to in paragraph (b)(i), the amount of such cash;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where the client has deposited collateral referred to in paragraph (b)(ii), the amount of the market value of such collateral, less the haircut amount in relation to the collateral; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where the client has deposited a bank guarantee referred to in paragraph (b)(iii), the amount that it can draw down under such bank guarantee.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed corporation must not— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: under subsection (2)(d), deem—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any amount of cash;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any collateral; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any amount that it can draw down under a bank guarantee,

paragraph.continued: to be security to the margined account concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: effect any reduction under subsection (2)(e) in respect of such security,

subsection.continued: if—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: such security has been deemed under subsection (2)(d) to be deposited as security to another margined account of the client; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in respect of such security a reduction under subsection (2)(e) has been effected in relation to another margined account of the client.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of these Rules, a licensed corporation must cease to treat— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any cash referred to in subsection (2)(b)(i);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any collateral referred to in subsection (2)(b)(ii); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any bank guarantee referred to in subsection (2)(b)(iii),

subsection.continued: as security in relation to the margined account of the client into which it was deposited, to the extent that such security—

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: has been deemed under subsection (2)(d) to be deposited as security to another margined account of the client; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: has been utilized to effect a reduction under subsection (2)(e).

def.name: SpecifiedShortfallAmount
def.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), specified shortfall amount (指明短欠數額) means an amount to be included in the licensed corporation’s ranking liabilities under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 40(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 41(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 43(10);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 45(2); or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 46(2).

def.name: MarginedAccount
def.leadIn: In this section, margined account (以保證金形式操作的帳戶), in relation to a client of a licensed corporation, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an account maintained with a licensed corporation licensed for Type 1 regulated activity by the client for the provision to him by the licensed corporation of securities margin financing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an account maintained with the licensed corporation by the client for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: short selling;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: dealings in futures contracts;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: dealings in unlisted options contracts; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: securities borrowing and lending;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: trading in leveraged foreign exchange contracts; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: entering into repurchase transactions.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Treatment of exercised options contracts
section.leadIn: A licensed corporation must, immediately upon the exercise of an options contract purchased, written or cleared by it, treat the options contract as having ceased to exist and account for— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all its assets; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all its liabilities,

subsection.content: A licensed corporation must not include in its liquid assets any amount receivable by it from any of its clients if such amount has been assigned by it to another person.

A licensed corporation must not treat any collateral or any other type of security deposited with it by any of its clients as so deposited where such collateral or other type of security has been assigned by it to another person.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Treatment of securities borrowing and lending agreements

subsection.leadIn: A licensed corporation which, under a securities borrowing and lending agreement, is the borrower of any securities, is deemed for the purposes of these Rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to remain the owner of any collateral beneficially owned by it and provided by it as security to the lender of the securities under the agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to have an amount receivable from that lender equal to the amount of cash provided by it as security to that lender; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not to own the securities borrowed under the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed corporation which, under a securities borrowing and lending agreement, is the lender of any securities, is deemed for the purposes of these Rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the securities lent under the agreement are beneficially owned by it, to remain the beneficial owner of the securities for the purposes of section 27;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not to own any collateral deposited with it as security by the borrower of the securities under the agreement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: to have an amount payable to that borrower equal to the amount of cash deposited with it as security by that borrower, unless the cash—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is not included in its liquid assets under section 20; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is held in a segregated account.

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensed corporation is the purchaser in the first instance of any securities under a repurchase transaction, it is deemed for the purposes of these Rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to have an amount receivable from the seller of the securities equal to the consideration for which it purchased the securities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not to own the securities purchased and so must not include them in its liquid assets under section 27. (L.N. 196 of 2018)
