paragraph.leadIn: the market value of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any shares listed on a specified exchange;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any qualifying debt securities; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any special debt securities,

paragraph.continued: deposited with it by the borrower as collateral, less the haircut amount in relation to such collateral; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 50% of the market value of any collateral, other than collateral referred to in paragraph (c), deposited with it by the borrower.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), a licensed corporation which, under a securities borrowing and lending agreement, is the lender of any securities as agent for another person, or where the securities are borrowed by it under another securities borrowing and lending agreement, must include in its ranking liabilities the amount by which the market value of the securities exceeds the aggregate of— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the maximum amount that it can draw under a bank guarantee provided to it as security by the borrower under the agreement and issued by an authorized financial institution or an approved bank incorporated outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of cash deposited with it as security by the borrower;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the market value of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any shares listed on a specified exchange;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any qualifying debt securities; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any special debt securities,

paragraph.continued: deposited with it by the borrower as collateral, less the haircut amount in relation to such collateral; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 50% of the market value of any collateral, other than collateral referred to in paragraph (c), deposited with it by the borrower.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed corporation which is the lender of securities under a securities borrowing and lending agreement must include in its ranking liabilities the amount payable to the borrower under the agreement in respect of any cash deposited with it as security by the borrower, save where the cash— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is held in a segregated account; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not included in its liquid assets under section 20.

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensed corporation borrows listed shares under a securities borrowing and lending agreement for the purpose of short selling for its own account, to the extent that the number of shares borrowed is equal to the number of shares short sold by it, subsection (1) does not apply in respect of the agreement and section 43(2) and (3) does not apply in respect of the shares short sold and it must include in its ranking liabilities the amount which is the higher of— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount that would arise under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the increased amount that would arise under section 43(2) or (3),

subsection.continued: but for this subsection.

subsection.content: Subsections (1), (2) and (3) do not apply in respect of a securities borrowing and lending agreement to which a licensed corporation is a party, where the other party to the agreement is an approved securities borrowing and lending counterparty.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed corporation which is the purchaser in the first instance of any securities in a repurchase transaction must include in its ranking liabilities the amount by which the amount included in its liquid assets under section 33 exceeds— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case where the securities are—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: shares listed on a specified exchange;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: qualifying debt securities; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: special debt securities,

paragraph.continued: 110% of their market value; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, 50% of the market value of the securities.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed corporation which is the seller in the first instance of any securities in a repurchase transaction must include in its ranking liabilities the amount by which the market value of the securities, less the haircut amount in relation to such securities, exceeds the aggregate of— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the maximum amount that it can draw under a bank guarantee provided to it as security by the purchaser of the securities and issued by an authorized financial institution or an approved bank incorporated outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of proceeds of sale of such securities received by it from the purchaser;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the market value of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any shares listed on a specified exchange;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any qualifying debt securities; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: any special debt securities,

paragraph.continued: deposited with it by the purchaser as collateral, less the haircut amount in relation to such collateral; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 50% of the market value of any collateral, other than collateral referred to in paragraph (c), deposited with it by the purchaser.

subsection.content: A licensed corporation which is the seller in the first instance of any securities in a repurchase transaction must include in its ranking liabilities the amount of the consideration for which it sold the securities. (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a licensed corporation which underwrites or sub-underwrites an issue or a sale of securities must include in its ranking liabilities— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a rights issue where the market price of the securities is less than or equal to their subscription price, the lower of—

subparagraph.leadIn: the aggregate of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: 50% of the haircut percentage in relation to the securities multiplied by the net underwriting commitment; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the amount by which the net underwriting commitment exceeds the market value of the securities; and
the net underwriting commitment; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: for a rights issue where the market price of the securities is greater than their subscription price, 5% of the haircut percentage in relation to the securities multiplied by the net underwriting commitment; or (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, 50% of the haircut percentage in relation to the securities multiplied by the net underwriting commitment.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a licensed corporation on the day on which it acquires an underwriting or a sub-underwriting commitment in respect of an issue or a sale of securities and the business day following that day.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), a licensed corporation acquires an underwriting or a sub-underwriting commitment in respect of an issue or a sale of securities at the later of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the time when it commits itself to underwrite or sub-underwrite the securities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time when the lead underwriter or co-lead underwriter signs the underwriting agreement with the issuer or the seller (as the case may be) of the securities.

def.name: NetUnderwritingCommitment
def.leadIn: In subsection (1), net underwriting commitment (包銷承擔淨額) means the total costs of subscribing for or purchasing securities underwritten or sub-underwritten by a licensed corporation other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: securities which are sub-underwritten; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: securities which are the subject of a legally binding contract for the subscription for or purchase of such securities,

def.continued: through or from that licensed corporation by another person.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a licensed corporation must include in its ranking liabilities the amount of any floating losses incurred by it in respect of any position in any off-exchange traded derivative contract.

Where a licensed corporation has entered into a bilateral netting agreement in respect of 2 or more off-exchange traded derivative contracts with the counterparty with whom it maintains the positions, it must include in its ranking liabilities the amount by which the amount of any floating losses incurred by it exceeds the amount of any floating profits made by it in respect of the contracts.

def.name: BilateralNettingAgreement
def.leadIn: In subsection (2), bilateral netting agreement (雙邊淨額結算協議) means an agreement between the licensed corporation and the counterparty with whom it maintains positions in off-exchange traded derivative contracts under which each party has a single obligation to the other in respect of all such contracts covered by the agreement and which provides that, in the event that the counterparty fails to comply with its obligation under the agreement, the licensed corporation will have—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a single claim to receive only the net amount of the aggregate positive mark-to-market value of any contract covered by the agreement, calculated by deducting from the aggregate positive mark-to-market value of any contract covered by the agreement the aggregate negative mark-to-market value of any other contract covered by the agreement; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a single obligation to pay only the net amount of the aggregate negative mark-to-market value of any contract covered by the agreement, calculated by deducting from the aggregate negative mark-to-market value of any contract covered by the agreement the aggregate positive mark-to-market value of any other contract covered by the agreement.

subsection.content: A licensed corporation which is a party to an interest rate swap agreement must include in its ranking liabilities the notional principal amount multiplied by the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 1 in Schedule 4 opposite the description of the remaining term to maturity in column 2 of the Table which is applicable to the agreement. (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subsection.def: In subsection (1), notional principal amount (名義本金額) means the theoretical amount agreed upon by the parties to an interest rate swap agreement on the basis of which any interest payment to be made under the agreement is calculated.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Foreign exchange agreements
section.content: A licensed corporation which is a party to a foreign exchange agreement must include in its ranking liabilities the amount of currency to be delivered by it under the agreement multiplied by the percentage specified in column 3 of Table 2 in Schedule 4 opposite the description of the counterparty and the remaining term to maturity in column 2 of the Table which is applicable to the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), where a licensed corporation introduces transactions which involve—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a dealing in any securities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a dealing in a futures contract or an unlisted options contract; or (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a trading in a leveraged foreign exchange contract,

subsection.continued: to another person for execution or clearing on behalf of any of its clients and—

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it does not include the amount receivable by it or payable to it in respect of any such transaction in the calculation of its liquid capital under this Part; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: there is neither express agreement nor a clear market practice that exempts it from any liability to the client or the other person in relation to such transaction,

subsection.continued: it must include in its ranking liabilities the amount by which its required liquid capital would have been increased had one or more of the following amounts been included in the calculation of its variable required liquid capital (as if the transaction had been executed or cleared by it)— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: (where the transaction introduced is a dealing in securities and the transaction has not been fully settled by the client or the other person (as the case may be)) the total value of the transaction entered into as a result of the introduction;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: (where the transaction introduced is a dealing in a futures contract or an unlisted options contract) the total amount of margin required to be deposited in respect of the futures contract or the unlisted options contract entered into as a result of the introduction which remains outstanding; (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: (where the transaction introduced is a trading in a leveraged foreign exchange contract) the aggregate gross foreign currency position arising from the leveraged foreign exchange contract entered into as a result of the introduction which remains outstanding.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the transaction is introduced is a member of a group of companies of which the licensed corporation is a member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person to whom the transaction is introduced has entered into an agreement with the client for providing the execution or clearing service to the client and is contractually liable to the client for any default in the execution or clearing of the transaction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the licensed corporation is not liable to the client for execution or clearing of such transactions or default by the person to whom the transaction is introduced.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a licensed corporation must include in its ranking liabilities 5% of its net position in each foreign currency.

In calculating the net position in a foreign currency, a licensed corporation may elect to exclude from the calculation the value of any asset which is denominated in that foreign currency and not included in its liquid assets under any provision in Division 3.

subsection.leadIn: If, in relation to a non-freely floating foreign currency, a licensed corporation has positions in the currency which are attributable to both the onshore and offshore markets in the currency, the licensed corporation must include in its ranking liabilities—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if its onshore net position in the currency and its offshore net position in the currency are both long positions or are both short positions—5% of the aggregate of the onshore net position and the offshore net position; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if paragraph (a) does not apply to it in relation to the currency—

subparagraph.content: 1.5% of the lower of its onshore net position in the currency and its offshore net position in the currency; and
5% of the difference between its onshore net position in the currency and its offshore net position in the currency.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: NetPosition
def.leadIn: net position (淨持倉量), in relation to a licensed corporation’s position in a foreign currency, means the difference between—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the aggregate of—

subparagraph.content: the value of assets, other than fixed assets, beneficially owned by the licensed corporation which are denominated in the foreign currency; and

the total amount of the foreign currency in respect of which the licensed corporation is exposed to the risk of a decline in the value of the foreign currency under outstanding contracts (including spot contracts); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the aggregate of—

subparagraph.content: all of the licensed corporation’s on-balance sheet liabilities, other than excluded liabilities, which are denominated in the foreign currency; and

the total amount of the foreign currency in respect of which the licensed corporation is exposed to the risk of a rise in the value of the foreign currency under outstanding contracts (including spot contracts);

def.name: NonfreelyFloatingForeignCurrency
def.leadIn: non-freely floating foreign currency (非自由浮動外幣) means a foreign currency in respect of which an authority of the jurisdiction of which the currency is the lawful currency specifies, in respect of one or more foreign exchange markets specified by the authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the rate at which the currency is permitted by the authority to be converted into one or more other currencies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a range of rates within which the currency is permitted by the authority to be converted into one or more other currencies;

subsection.def: offshore net position (境外淨持倉量), in relation to a licensed corporation’s net position in a non-freely floating foreign currency, means its net position in the currency which is attributable to the offshore market in the currency;

onshore net position (境內淨持倉量), in relation to a licensed corporation’s net position in a non-freely floating foreign currency, means its net position in the currency which is attributable to the onshore market in the currency.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed corporation must include in its ranking liabilities— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 10% of the amount of any guarantee, indemnity or other similar financial commitment provided by it, directly or indirectly (including the pledging of assets for the purpose of obtaining a bank guarantee), other than a guarantee, an indemnity and other financial commitment provided by it in respect of its own liabilities and obligations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount by which the liabilities of any subsidiary of it (excluding any amounts due to it from the subsidiary) exceed the assets of the subsidiary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the consideration it is obliged to pay for the redemption of redeemable shares, other than approved redeemable shares, which have not yet been redeemed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if it has made one or more elections under section 18A(3) in relation to one or more controlled assets denominated in a particular currency, the amount (if it exceeds zero) calculated in accordance with the following formula—

td.p: is the aggregate of the amounts that it is required to include in its liquid assets in respect of the controlled assets denominated in the currency; and

is the aggregate of the amounts of its existing obligations or liabilities denominated in the currency (which the controlled assets may be freely applied to meet) that it is required (apart from by this paragraph) to include in its ranking liabilities; and (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: where it is the underwriter of a note issuance and revolving underwriting facility, the maximum amount that can be drawn down by the issuer under the facility by issuing notes less the amount that has been drawn down by the issuer by issuing and placing notes multiplied by the percentage specified in column 3 of Schedule 5 opposite the description of the remaining term to maturity in column 2 of the Schedule which is applicable to the facility.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (1A) and (2), a licensed corporation must include in its ranking liabilities all its liabilities not otherwise required to be included in its ranking liabilities under any other provision of this Division, including— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any amount payable by it in relation to any overdraft obtained by it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any amount payable by it in relation to any loan obtained by it;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any accrued interest payable by it to any other person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any accrued expenses incurred by it;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: any provision made by it for contingent liabilities;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any provision made by it for floating losses in respect of open positions held for its own account; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any other liabilities provided for in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: In relation to any liabilities of a licensed corporation which arise from a tenancy agreement entered into by it in respect of any premises which it uses in carrying on the regulated activity for which it is licensed, subsection (1) only applies to any amount by which its on-balance sheet liabilities arising from the tenancy agreement exceeds the total value of its assets arising from the tenancy agreement which are not included in its liquid assets under any provision in Division 3. (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: A licensed corporation must not include in its ranking liabilities— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any approved subordinated loan provided to it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any liability that it is not required to settle within the next 12 months and is secured by a first legal charge on immovable property beneficially owned by it and used in carrying on the regulated activity for which it is licensed, to the extent that the net realizable value of that property equals such liability.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Licensed corporations to notify Commission of failure to comply with these Rules

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensed corporation notifies the Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 146(1) of the Ordinance that it is unable to maintain, or to ascertain whether it maintains, financial resources in accordance with the specified amount requirements that apply to it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under section 146(3) of the Ordinance that it is unable to comply with, or to ascertain whether it complies with, all or any of the requirements of these Rules, other than the specified amount requirements,

subsection.continued: it must include in the notice— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: full details of the matter and the reason therefor; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: full details of any steps it is taking, has taken or proposes to take to redress the inability.

subsection.content: The Commission may, where a licensed corporation gives notice to the Commission under section 146(1) and (3) of the Ordinance, request the licensed corporation to provide, in such form and within such time as the Commission may specify, such additional information and document as the Commission may require in connection with the matter, whereupon the licensed corporation must comply with the request accordingly. (L.N. 196 of 2018)

def.name: SpecifiedAmountRequirements
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this section and section 144 of the Ordinance, specified amount requirements (指明數額規定), in relation to a licensed corporation, means the applicable requirements specified in section 4 and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement to maintain paid-up share capital in the amount required under section 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirement to maintain liquid capital not less than its required liquid capital under section 6.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Licensed corporations to notify Commission of circumstances relating to financial resources and trading activities and to submit returns in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: A licensed corporation must notify the Commission in writing as soon as reasonably practicable and in any event within one business day of becoming aware of any of the following matters— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its liquid capital falls below 120% of its required liquid capital;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a required liquid capital deficit occurs, but the licensed corporation is regarded as having complied with section 6(1) by virtue of section 6(3);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its liquid capital falls below 50% of the liquid capital stated in its last return submitted to the Commission under section 56(1) or (3);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any information contained in any of its previous returns submitted to the Commission pursuant to these Rules has become false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the aggregate of the amounts it has drawn down on any loan, advance, credit facility or other financial accommodation provided to it by banks exceeds the aggregate of the credit limits thereof;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: it has been or will be unable, for 3 consecutive business days, to meet in whole or in part any calls or demands for payment or repayment (as the case may be), from any of its lenders, credit providers or financial accommodation providers;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any of its lenders or any person who has provided credit or financial accommodation to it has exercised, or has informed it that he will exercise, the right to liquidate security provided by it to him in order to reduce its liability or indebtedness to him under any outstanding loan, advance, credit facility balance or other financial accommodation provided to it by him;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: the aggregate of the maximum amounts that can be drawn down against it under any guarantee, indemnity or any other similar financial commitment provided by it—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: exceeds $5,000,000; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: would, if deducted from its liquid capital, cause its liquid capital to fall below 120% of its required liquid capital;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the aggregate of amounts of any outstanding claim made in writing by it or against it (whether disputed or not) exceeds or is likely to exceed $5,000,000;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the aggregate of amounts of any outstanding claim made in writing by it or against it (whether disputed or not) would, if deducted from its liquid capital, cause its liquid capital to fall below 120% of its required liquid capital;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: any claim is made by it under any professional indemnity or other insurance policy that it is required to maintain under any rules made under section 116(5) of the Ordinance or the rules or conventions of any exchange or clearing house;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: any financial commitment, including a guarantee, is provided for it in favour of an exchange or a clearing house, by a corporation which is a member of a group of companies of which it is a member.

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensed corporation notifies the Commission of any matter under subsection (1), it must— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: include in the notice full details of the matter and the reason therefor; and (L.N. 117 of 2006)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a notification under subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (e), (f) or (g), include in the notice full details of any steps it is taking, has taken or proposes to take to prevent its liquid capital from falling below its required liquid capital or to improve its liquidity. (L.N. 117 of 2006)

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensed corporation has, prior to the commencement of these Rules, entered into any position in an off-exchange traded derivative contract other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an options contract written by it on its own account;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an interest rate swap agreement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a foreign exchange agreement,

subsection.continued: of which it has not notified the Commission prior to the commencement of these Rules, it must within one business day of the commencement of these Rules notify the Commission in writing of the details of such position.

subsection.leadIn: Where a licensed corporation intends to enter into any position in an off-exchange traded derivative contract other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an unlisted options contract written by it on its own account;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an interest rate swap agreement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a foreign exchange agreement,

subsection.continued: it must notify the Commission in writing of the details of the position it intends to enter into at least 10 business days before entering into the position.

subsection.content: Where a licensed corporation intends to change any of its accounting principles in a way that may materially affect the liquid capital or paid-up share capital that it maintains or is required to maintain under Part 3, for the purposes of section 3(2), it must notify the Commission in writing of the details of, and the reasons for, the intended change not less than 5 business days prior to effecting the change.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Licensed corporations to submit returns to Commission

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), a licensed corporation licensed for one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Type 1 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Type 2 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Type 3 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Type 4 regulated activity, and it is not subject to the specified licensing condition;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Type 5 regulated activity, and it is not subject to the specified licensing condition;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Type 6 regulated activity, and it is not subject to the specified licensing condition;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Type 7 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: Type 8 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: Type 9 regulated activity, and it is not subject to the specified licensing condition; (L.N. 29 of 2011)

paragraph.name: ia
paragraph.content: Type 10 regulated activity, and it is not subject to the specified licensing condition; (L.N. 29 of 2011; L.N. 56 of 2023)

paragraph.name: 1b
paragraph.content: Type 13 regulated activity, (L.N. 56 of 2023)

subsection.continued: must, in respect of each month at the end of which it remains licensed, submit to the Commission, in the manner specified in subsection (5) and no later than 3 weeks after the end of the month concerned, a return which is in the form specified by the Commission under section 402 of the Ordinance and signed in the manner specified in subsection (6), and includes— (L.N. 92 of 2008; L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: its liquid capital computation, as at the end of the month;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: its required liquid capital computation, as at the end of the month;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: a summary of bank loans, advances, credit facilities and other financial accommodation available to it, as at the end of the month;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: an analysis of its margin clients, as at the end of the month;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: an analysis of collateral received from its margin clients, as at the end of the month;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: an analysis of its rolling balance cash clients, as at the end of the month;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: an analysis of its profit and loss account;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: other than a licensed corporation licensed for Type 13 regulated activity in relation to the carrying on by it of Type 13 regulated activity, an analysis of its client assets, as at the end of the month; (L.N. 56 of 2023)

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: where it is licensed for Type 3 regulated activity, an analysis of its foreign currency positions, as at the end of the month; and (L.N. 56 of 2023)

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: where it is licensed for Type 13 regulated activity, an analysis of relevant CIS property received or held by it for any relevant CIS arising from the carrying on of Type 13 regulated activity, as at the end of the month. (L.N. 56 of 2023)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), a licensed corporation to which subsection (1) applies must, in respect of each period of 3 months at the end of which it remains licensed, being such period in a year ending at the end of the month of March, June, September or December, respectively, submit to the Commission, in the manner specified in subsection (5) and no later than 3 weeks after the end of the period concerned, a return which is in the form specified by the Commission under section 402 of the Ordinance and signed in the manner specified in subsection (6), and includes— (L.N. 92 of 2008; L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an analysis of its clientele, as at the end of the 3 month period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an analysis of its proprietary derivative positions, as at the end of the 3 month period;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where it is licensed for Type 3 regulated activity, an analysis of its recognized counterparties, as at the end of the 3 month period; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where it is licensed for Type 9 regulated activity, an analysis of the assets under its management, as at the end of the 3 month period.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), a licensed corporation which is licensed solely for one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Type 4 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Type 5 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Type 6 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Type 9 regulated activity; (L.N. 29 of 2011)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: Type 10 regulated activity, (L.N. 29 of 2011)

subsection.continued: and subject to the specified licensing condition, must, in respect of each period of 6 months at the end of which it remains licensed, being such period in a year ending at the end of the month of June or December, respectively, submit to the Commission, in the manner specified in subsection (5) and no later than 3 weeks after the end of the period concerned, a return which is in the form specified by the Commission under section 402 of the Ordinance and signed in the manner specified in subsection (6), and includes— (L.N. 92 of 2008; L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: its liquid capital computation, as at the end of the 6 month period;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: its required liquid capital computation, as at the end of the 6 month period;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: an analysis of its profit and loss account;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an analysis of its clientele, as at the end of the 6 month period; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: where it is licensed for Type 9 regulated activity, an analysis of the assets under its management, as at the end of the 6 month period.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed corporation may elect to submit the return required under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (1), in respect of periods of not less than 28 days but not more than 35 days, each ending not more than 7 days before or after the end of a month;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (2), in respect of periods of 3 months each ending not more than 7 days before or after the end of March, June, September or December in a year;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subsection (3), in respect of periods of 6 months each ending not more than 7 days before or after the end of June or December in a year,

subsection.continued: determined by it on a basis according to which the ending date of each period so determined is predictable, and where it so elects and submits the return concerned, it is deemed to have submitted the return concerned in respect of the period required under subsection (1), (2) or (3) (as the case may be). (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a licensed corporation must submit a return referred to in this section to the Commission electronically by means of an online communication system approved by the Commission under section 58(7) for the purposes of this subsection. (L.N. 92 of 2008; L.N. 196 of 2018)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a return referred to in this section must be signed on behalf of the licensed corporation concerned by a responsible officer of the licensed corporation or another officer of the licensed corporation approved by the Commission under section 58(5)(e) for the purposes of this section, by way of attachment to the return of the digital signature or electronic signature of the responsible officer or other officer; and (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the signature referred to in paragraph (a) must— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a digital signature, be supported by a recognized certificate, generated within the validity of that certificate and used in accordance with the terms of that certificate; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of an electronic signature, be authenticated in accordance with such directions and instructions for the use of the online communication system concerned as are published by the Commission under section 58(8). (L.N. 92 of 2008)

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (6)(b)(i), a digital signature is taken to be supported by a recognized certificate if it is taken to be supported by that certificate under section 2(2) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553). (14 of 2004 s. 30; L.N. 92 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: digital signature (數碼簽署) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (14 of 2004 s. 30)
electronic signature (電子簽署) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (L.N. 92 of 2008)
recognized certificate (認可證書) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553); (14 of 2004 s. 30)

rolling balance cash client (滾存結餘現金客戶) means a client of a licensed corporation in respect of whom the amounts receivable from, and amounts payable to, him by the licensed corporation arising from the purchase and sale of securities on a cash-against-delivery basis by the licensed corporation for him may be set-off by the licensed corporation under section 21(3);
within the validity of that certificate (在該證書的有效期內) has the meaning assigned to it by section 6(2) of the Electronic Transactions Ordinance (Cap. 553).

section.name: s57
section.heading: Licensed corporations to provide information
section.content: The Commission may at any time, by notice in writing, request a licensed corporation to provide it within the time and in the manner specified in the notice with such information, including any record or document, as it may specify in the notice relating to the financial resources or trading activities of the licensed corporation, whereupon the licensed corporation must comply with the request accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of these Rules, the Commission may, whether or not on application in writing and payment of the fee prescribed in the Securities and Futures (Fees) Rules (Cap. 571 sub. leg. AF), approve a person as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approved bank incorporated outside Hong Kong, where the person is a bank which is incorporated under the law or other authority of any jurisdiction outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an approved credit rating agency; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an approved securities borrowing and lending counterparty.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission approves a person under subsection (1), it must as soon as reasonably practicable— (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish in such manner as it considers appropriate the name of the person approved; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a person approved under subsection (1)(b), specify the ratings issued by the person as being equivalent to a specified rating issued by Moody’s Investors Service, Standard & Poor’s Corporation or Fitch Ratings.

subsection.content: A person approved under subsection (1)(c) must be a person whose activities or objects include the provision of services for interposing himself in a securities borrowing and lending agreement as the counterparty to both the borrower and the lender, including administering any security deposited with him in connection with the agreement and registration and settlement of the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, on application in writing and payment of the fee prescribed in the Securities and Futures (Fees) Rules (Cap. 571 sub. leg. AF), approve a licensed corporation for the purposes of these Rules as an approved introducing agent where the licensed corporation satisfies the Commission that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: it is licensed solely for Type 1 regulated activity, it conducts no business other than—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: communicating offers to effect dealings in securities to an exchange participant of a recognized exchange company or a specified exchange, in the names of the persons from whom those offers are received; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: introducing persons to an exchange participant of a recognized exchange company or a specified exchange, in order that they may—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: effect dealings in securities; or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: make offers to deal in securities;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: it is licensed solely for Type 2 regulated activity, it conducts no business other than—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: communicating offers to effect dealings in futures contracts or unlisted options contracts to an exchange participant of a recognized exchange company or a specified exchange, in the names of the persons from whom those offers are received; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: introducing persons to an exchange participant of a recognized exchange company or a specified exchange, in order that they may—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: effect dealings in futures contracts or unlisted options contracts; or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: make offers to deal in futures contracts or unlisted options contracts;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: it is licensed solely for Type 3 regulated activity, it conducts no business other than—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: communicating offers to effect leveraged foreign exchange trading to a recognized counterparty in the names of the persons from whom those offers are received; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: introducing persons to a recognized counterparty in order that they may—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: effect trading in leveraged foreign exchange contracts; or

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: make offers to trade in leveraged foreign exchange contracts; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.leadIn: it is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.leadIn: licensed for one or more of the following—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: Type 1 regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: Type 2 regulated activity;

subparagraph.name: III
subparagraph.content: Type 3 regulated activity; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.leadIn: licensed for one or more of the regulated activities referred to in sub-subparagraph (A) and one or more of the following—

subparagraph.name: I
subparagraph.content: Type 4 regulated activity, and it is subject to the specified licensing condition;

subparagraph.name: II
subparagraph.content: Type 5 regulated activity, and it is subject to the specified licensing condition;

subparagraph.name: III
subparagraph.content: Type 6 regulated activity, and it is subject to the specified licensing condition,

subparagraph.continued: and not licensed for any regulated activity other than as described in sub-subparagraphs (A) and (B), and in relation to any one or more of the regulated activities referred to in sub-subparagraph (A) for which it is licensed, it conducts no business other than that described in subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in connection with the offers communicated or the persons so introduced, it will not incur any liability to any person except for its own negligence, wilful default or fraud; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it does not hold client assets.

subsection.leadIn: The Commission may, on application in writing by a licensed corporation and payment of the fee prescribed in the Securities and Futures (Fees) Rules (Cap. 571 sub. leg. AF), approve—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: as approved redeemable shares, any redeemable shares issued by the licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as an approved subordinated loan, any subordinated loan obtained by the licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: as an approved standby subordinated loan facility, any standby subordinated loan facility obtained by the licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 3(3), the adoption by the licensed corporation of an accounting principle other than one of those referred to in section 3(1)(a);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 56(6), an officer of the licensed corporation to sign a return; (L.N. 92 of 2008)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 41(1)(a)(v), a foreign currency;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the withdrawal of an election made by the licensed corporation under any provision of these Rules;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the calculation of the haircut percentage applicable to an underlying basket of securities as the weighted average of the haircut percentages applicable to each of the securities which constitute the basket—

subparagraph.content: for special debt securities which fall within the description set out in item 1(b)(iii) or 2(a)(ii) in column 2 of Table 6 in Schedule 2; or
for specified securities which fall within the description set out in item 2(b) or 3(a)(vii) in column 2 of Table 7 in Schedule 2; and (L.N. 196 of 2018)

paragraph.content: for the purposes of section 11(7), the setting-off by the licensed corporation of amounts receivable (except amounts receivable referred to in section 23(1)(f)) by it from, and amounts payable by it to, a general clearing participant of HKSCC which arise from transactions in securities that are cleared for it or its clients by the participant with HKSCC. (L.N. 196 of 2018)

subsection.content: An approval granted under subsection (1), (4) or (5) is subject to such reasonable conditions as the Commission may impose, and the Commission may at any time revoke the approval or amend or revoke any such condition or impose new conditions as may be reasonable in the circumstances.
The Commission may, for the purposes of section 56(5), approve an online communication system. (L.N. 92 of 2008)

Where the Commission approves an online communication system under subsection (7), it must as soon as reasonably practicable publish directions and instructions for the use of that system in such manner as it considers appropriate. (L.N. 92 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: An approval granted under subsection (1), (4), (5) or (7) remains in force—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where a period of validity of the approval is specified in the notice of approval, until the expiry of the period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where no such period is specified, until revoked by the Commission by notice in writing.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Withdrawal of elections made under these Rules
section.content: A licensed corporation which makes an election under any provision of these Rules is bound by the election until such time as the Commission approves the withdrawal of the election under section 58(5)(g).

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding section 1 and subject to subsection (5), section 5 does not apply in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a partnership deemed under section 27 of Part 1 of Schedule 10 to the Ordinance to be a licensed corporation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an individual deemed under section 30 of Part 1 of Schedule 10 to the Ordinance to be a licensed corporation,

subsection.continued: provided that—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a partnership, the aggregate of amounts maintained in all partners’ capital accounts; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of an individual, the amount maintained in his capital account,

subsection.continued: is not less than the amount of paid-up share capital required of a licensed corporation under section 5, until such time as the specified decision referred to, in the case of a partnership, in section 53(1)(b) of Part 1 of Schedule 10 to the Ordinance or, in the case of an individual, in section 53(1)(c) of Part 1 of Schedule 10 to the Ordinance, takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of these Rules, a transaction executed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a partnership deemed under section 27 of Part 1 of Schedule 10 to the Ordinance to be a licensed corporation, for the account of a partner of the partnership; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an individual deemed under section 30 of Part 1 of Schedule 10 to the Ordinance to be a licensed corporation, for his own account,

subsection.continued: shall be treated as a transaction executed by it or him (as the case may be) for a client.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding section 1 and subject to subsection (6), these Rules do not apply in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a partnership deemed under section 27 of Part 1 of Schedule 10 to the Ordinance to be a licensed corporation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an individual deemed under section 30 of Part 1 of Schedule 10 to the Ordinance to be a licensed corporation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a licensed corporation,

subsection.continued: which is licensed solely for one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Type 4 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Type 5 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Type 6 regulated activity;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Type 9 regulated activity,

subsection.continued: provided that it or he (as the case may be) maintains net tangible assets in an amount of not less than $500,000.

subsection.content: Subsection (5) shall expire at the expiration of 6 months from the commencement of these Rules.

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.content: Where a licensed corporation is licensed immediately prior to 1 October 2006 for Type 1 or Type 8 regulated activity, for the period from 1 October 2006 to 30 September 2007, the reference in section 42(2) to 80% shall be construed as a reference to 65%. (L.N. 117 of 2006)

subsection.def: capital account (資本帳) means an account in which the amount of capital injected into the business of a partnership or sole-proprietorship is kept;
